questions.question_text:
A customer just signed a contract for a 20% discount on all parts and labor for the next year based on a preset price list.

You need to ensure this customer receives the appropriate discount on all work order parts and labor.

Which two actions should you perform in Dynamics 365 Field Service? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
AD.

A. Create an agreement with the applicable invoice terms
Agreements in Field Service define recurring work orders, pricing structures, and invoice terms. Since the customer has a contract for a year, an agreement is the best way to ensure consistent discounts apply to all work orders during that period.

D. Create a price list with the appropriate products, services, and pricing discounts
A price list ensures that the correct prices (with the 20% discount) are automatically applied to all parts and labor. The price list should be associated with the agreement or work orders for this customer.

Why not B? Entitlements in Field Service are used to define free or discounted service based on specific conditions (e.g., warranty work, support cases). Since the customer signed a contract for a discount, an entitlement is not the best fit for this scenario.

choices.A: Create an agreement with the applicable invoice terms.
choices.C: Create an agreement and service-level agreement with the applicable invoice terms and escalation point.
choices.D: Create a price list with the appropriate products, services, and pricing discounts.
choices.B: Create an entitlement with the applicable entitlement terms and field service details.

questions.question_text:
Your company's product inventory specialists use the Field Service mobile app to manage inventory, purchasing, and returns.

You need to train the product inventory specialists on the processing actions available with return merchandise authorizations (RMA).

Which three processing actions are available? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
BCD.

B. Return to Vendor (RTV) – This action is used when defective or unwanted items need to be sent back to the supplier or manufacturer.

C. Return to Warehouse – This option allows inventory specialists to return items to the warehouse for restocking or further inspection.

D. Return for Replacement – This action is used when a customer requests a replacement for a defective or incorrect item.

Incorrect ones:
A. Change Equipment Ownership – This is not an RMA action; it is related to transferring ownership of equipment to another party, such as a customer or another business unit.

E. Return for Repair – While repairs are part of service operations, RMA typically deals with returning items rather than sending them for repair.
